top.title: Could US Congress stop Trump from taking over Greenland?
top.summary: Some of the president's fellow Republicans oppose him - but it's not clear if they would join Democrats to block a takeover of the island.

top.title: Israeli PM Netanyahu agrees to join Trump's Board of Peace
top.summary: Israel is the latest country to publicly accept an invitation to a new international organisation that many fear may be designed to supplant the UN.

top.title: Photos leaked to BBC show faces of hundreds killed in Iran's brutal protest crackdown
top.summary: The images from one mortuary in Tehran were shown to families who went to identify their loved ones.

top.title: Snap settles social media addiction lawsuit ahead of trial
top.summary: TikTok, YouTube and Meta remain defendants in the case, which is due to kick off next week.

top.title: UK consulting on bringing in social media ban for under 16s
top.summary: The government said it expected schools to be "phone-free by default" as a result of the announcement.

top.title: How crypto criminals stole $700 million from people - often using age-old tricks
top.summary: As crypto wealth continues to grow, criminals are mixing sophisticated hacks with deception, and in some cases, real life violence.
